intro: Marah fabacea var. agrestis, commonly known as the wild cucumber, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes other cucurbits like pumpkins and melons. The plant features trailing stems with heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruits are elongated, green berries that turn orange when mature. The plant is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as fields and riverbanks.
